name: claude-secure-terminal
description: A secure terminal interface for Claude Desktop with comprehensive security controls, audit logging, and configurable permissions.
long_description: Execute system commands safely through Claude Desktop with enterprise-grade security features including command whitelisting, directory restrictions, output limiting, execution timeouts, and comprehensive audit logging. Perfect for development workflows, system administration, and debugging while maintaining complete security and compliance.

allowed_directories.title: Allowed Directories
allowed_directories.description: Directories where terminal commands can be executed. Commands will be restricted to these paths for security.

max_output_lines.title: Maximum Output Lines
max_output_lines.description: Maximum number of output lines to display (prevents flooding)

timeout_seconds.title: Command Timeout (seconds)
timeout_seconds.description: Maximum time a command can run before being terminated

log_all_commands.title: Enable Audit Logging
log_all_commands.description: Log all command executions for security audit purposes

additional_commands.title: Additional Allowed Commands
additional_commands.description: Comma-separated list of additional commands to allow (beyond the default safe list)

tools.name: execute_command
tools.description: Execute a terminal command safely with security restrictions and audit logging

tools.name: list_allowed_commands
tools.description: List all commands that are currently allowed to be executed

tools.name: get_terminal_status
tools.description: Get current terminal extension status and configuration

tools.name: search_command_history
tools.description: Search through command execution history and logs

prompts.name: system_analysis
prompts.description: Analyze system status and provide insights
prompts.text: Analyze the current system status and provide insights about ${arguments.focus_area}. Use the terminal to check relevant system metrics, processes, and configurations.

prompts.name: debug_environment
prompts.text: Help debug the following development environment issue: ${arguments.issue_description}. Use terminal commands to diagnose the problem and suggest solutions.

prompts.name: security_audit
prompts.description: Perform security audit of command history
prompts.text: Perform a security audit of command execution history for the ${arguments.time_period} period. Review command logs, identify potential security issues, and provide recommendations.
